message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.SI. 

This paper presents a novel Bayesian topic model for learning discourse-level document structure. The paper focuses on natural language processing and machine learning techniques to model the structure of documents. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also proposes a global model that can be applied to a collection of related documents, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper discusses information ordering, which is a common problem in information retrieval, suggesting that it could belong to cs.IR (Information Retrieval). The paper also leverages insights from discourse theory, which is a subfield of linguistics, suggesting that it could belong to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) or cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
